[LEXICON]: Use of archaic or overly formal language (e.g., "presided at his birth," "irksome task," "veritable passion")
[SYNTAX]: Some long, complex sentences with nested clauses that may slow reading flow
[PUNCTUATION]: Overuse of semicolons and colons in extended narrative passages

[LOGIC]: Sudden, unexplained technological references ("The hologram flickered to life," "A smart bulb changed color") disrupt historical narrative
[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between family chronology and Rosa's artistic development without clear narrative bridges
[STRUCTURE]: Inconsistent temporal markers (e.g., "In 1833, we find him installed..." after earlier detailed chronology)

[LEXICON]: Anachronistic reference to "smartwatch" in a historical context.
[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in "Few painters have so far insisted upon this honesty..."

[STRUCTURE]: Sudden, jarring insertion of "Notifications appeared on the smartwatch" disrupts historical narrative flow.
[CLARITY]: Vague reference to "Later on" without clear temporal markers.
